node.contents: I have discovered a workaround.

astNode.text: I have discovered a workaround.

node.contents: In my case, I was showing the ad from within a service running in a custom process. For example:

astNode.text: In my case, I was showing the ad from within a service running in a custom process. For example:

node.contents: In my AndroidManifest.xml, I then set the same android:process attribute for the declared AdActivity, and the problem went away.

astNode.text: In my AndroidManifest.xml, I then set the same android:process attribute for the declared AdActivity, and the problem went away.

node.contents: In the case of my application, I don't particularly care which process the ad activity runs in, so this workaround is sufficient. Hopefully this will be of some use to others.

astNode.text: In the case of my application, I don't particularly care which process the ad activity runs in, so this workaround is sufficient. Hopefully this will be of some use to others.

node.contents: Trying that I face a problem due to many "threads" and Google Ad incomplete requests (I guess) which in some cases (Wildfire S - 2.3.3, Samsung Galaxy S II - 2.3.5) stuck the whole screen (contains WebView) and does not load anything. Sure that solution doesn't help in my case.

astNode.text: Trying that I face a problem due to many "threads" and Google Ad incomplete requests (I guess) which in some cases (Wildfire S - 2.3.3, Samsung Galaxy S II - 2.3.5) stuck the whole screen (contains WebView) and does not load anything. Sure that solution doesn't help in my case.

node.contents: This is a partial solution and it seems (so far) to fix 100% the crashes: you should postpone the ad request a few milliseconds to avoid this crash!

astNode.text: This is a partial solution and it seems (so far) to fix 100% the crashes: you should postpone the ad request a few milliseconds to avoid this crash!
